New Program Outcomes: PO1 Apply knowledge of (1) mathematics, (2) natural science, (3) engineering fundamentals and (4) specialization in XXX Engineering to the (5) solution of complex engineering problems;
WA/EAC Program Outcomes: WA1 Apply knowledge of mathematics, natural science, engineering fundamentals and an engineering specialization as specified in WK1 to WK4 respectively to the solution of complex engineering problems;
Engineers Australia Revised Stage 1 Comp: 1.3 In-depth understanding of specialist bodies of knowledge within the engineering discipline

WA/EAC Program Outcomes: EAC1 Apply knowledge of mathematics, natural science, engineering fundamentals and an engineering specialisation as specified in WK1 to WK4 respectively to the solution of complex engineering problems;
Engineers Australia Revised Stage 1 Comp: 2.1 Application of established engineering methods to complex engineering problem solving.

WA/EAC Program Outcomes: WA2 Identify, formulate, research literature and analyse complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences and engineering sciences;

WA/EAC Program Outcomes: EAC3 Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design systems, components or processes that meet specified needs with appropriate consideration for public health and safety, cultural, societal, and environmental considerations (WK5);
